intro: Tupacamaria junceaoides, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous small seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Tupacamaria junceaoides plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for pollinators in its native habitat.
